Team Fortress 2 is a free-to-play First Person Shooter made the By VALVe. It revolves around the 9 diverse classes that you play as in the 100+ maps and 14 and counting game modes. It offers an amazing amount of fun for something that is free. Tf2 isn't Pay 2 Win in any fashion besides looking like a badass, Who paid 50$ for that cool looking hat on the market, and giving you some more slots. Just cough up 10 cents and your good to go. Overall, it is fun, diverse and has more content added by the.......oh...hmmmmmmm...... a couple months....maybe? But thats besides the point, it's fun, it's funny, and it's funnier than Skyrim. What more can you ask for?

This game is very fun and can make you laugh (alot) but the only bad thing for new players is the learning curve. if i have to say one thing to new players is know what your team needs and practice (lots of practice). make shour you know what you are doing and try to do it no mater how much you fail. just keep trying and you will sucssed eventually.

The casual servers are swarming with aimbot players.
It is a nice casual game if you have a few friends to play with, but casual servers are unbalanced in most of the cases. Random crits are fair and balanced and respawn times should be skippable or otherwise compensated because it can be really boring.
